Key Arguments: The proposed bill is seen as a major overreach by the government.
The government and legacy media are exempt from the bill, which is viewed as unfair.
Governments and mainstream media have themselves distributed misinformation, particularly regarding COVID-19 vaccinations.
Social media has been a source of truth, contrary to the narrative pushed by mainstream media.
The bill would have led to censorship of politicians and groups opposing mainstream narratives.
Examples of censorship include the removal of the 'Died Suddenly' Facebook group and misreporting of protest sizes by mainstream media.
The bill threatens free speech and the public's ability to make informed decisions.
Main Themes: Role of social media in truth dissemination
Notable Quotes: I believe the proposed misinformation/ disinformation bill 2023 to be a major overreach.
Governments and mainstream media outlets at all levels were distributing their own misinformation and disinformation.
The only location where any truth could be located at this time was on some comments and posts on some social media outlets.
Therefore, I completely oppose the proposed misinformation/ dysinformation bill 2023.
